title: SoC RTVF 369-0-21 Topics in Acting for the Screen

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
RTVF 369-0 Sec. 21 Topics in Acting for the Screen: Devised Narrative - meets Th 12:00-2:50 in Louis 106

OVERVIEW: Intended for RTVF and Theatre students, this class will examine the process of performance and narrative-creation via the increasingly utilized mode of improvisation. Utilizing long-form class exercises, students will work towards creating devised short film projects, both scripted (finally) and improvised, culminating in a final ensemble mini-movie.

LEARNING OBJECTIVES: Students will develop a working knowledge of improvisation, narrative-creation and advanced film acting technique.

TEACHING METHOD: in-class workshops and scenes, out-of-class student-directed filmed projects

EVALUATION METHOD: Class participation, filmed projects.
